thread.title: Dimitri Payet nets first Marseille goal since big-money return as OM see off Guingamp in Ligue 1
thread.title_full: Dimitri Payet nets first Marseille goal since big-money return as OM see off Guingamp in Ligue 1

author: Alex Richards
title: Dimitri Payet nets first Marseille goal since big-money return as OM see off Guingamp in Ligue 1
text:
Payet celebrates finding the net (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Marseille's big plans under new ownership are beginning to take place and the crown jewel in the club's new era, Dimitri Payet, scored his first goal since returning in a 2-0 win over Guingamp on Wednesday night. 
Payet, 29, returned to OM in a Â£25million move from West Ham last month, having gone on strike at the London Stadium to force a return to the Stade Velodrome. 
His return hadn't produced an immediate upturn in form however - with Marseille having lost three of their last four in Ligue 1. 
But Rudi Garcia's men landed an important three points with victory over Antoine Kombouare's side, to move four points off fourth place Lyon and a guaranteed Europa League spot. Payet celebrates with striker Bafetimbi Gomis (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
New OM owner Frank McCourt is preparing more big spending in the summer, and Garcia - hired in October - is the man he wants to lead the club into a bright new future, dubbed 'the Champions Project'. 
The ex-Lille boss has a reputation for fast, free-flowing football, and after a slow start on France's south coast, is beginning to put together a side hoping to challenge at the top of Ligue 1 next summer. 
A Champions League place looks out of the question this term, with them 16 points off the top three with just 14 matches remaining. 
But optimism is growing that the 1993 European Cup winners will be among the contenders in 2016-17. Payet has been signed to lead Marseille back into the Champions League spots (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
At the heart of that will be Payet and 22-year-old midfielder Morgan Sanson, also signed last month, and the pair were instrumental in a deserved victory. 
Sanson played his part in the opener, his clever flicked header playing through ex-Swansea striker Bafetimbi Gomis, who fired home after 26 minutes. Gomis lashes home for Marseille (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Gomis and Newcastle reject Remy Cabella celebrate (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
And former Hammer Payet made the game safe with 15 minutes remaining. 
In typical pose, the playmaker lined up a freekick from 30 yards, and while it wasn't his truest connection, the wicked deflection off the wall wrong-footed goalkeeper Karl Johnsson, to guarantee victory. 
From that point, Guingamp - with just one point from the last 15 available - never looked like getting back into things. 
Marseille head to Nantes at the weekend in their next fixture, having drawn level with fifth-placed Saint Etienne. Like us on Facebook
